personalInfo.name: Sonali Sinha
personalInfo.title: Barnard College, Columbia University
personalInfo.bio: First-year student interested in computer science, cognitive science, and math
personalInfo.location: San Francisco, CA | New York, NY

education.description: Columbia Undergraduate Science Journal, Columbia AI Alignment Club Technical Fellowship (Fall '25), Gourmand Food Club

research.title: BU RISE Practicum in Computational Neurobiology
research.description: An intensive introduction to neuroscience and computational neurobiology, this course combined lectures, programming and modeling labs, wet-lab experiments, research training, and collaborative practicum work.

publications.title: Broadband Coupling to Slow-Wave Phase Acts as a Biomarker for Brain State in Ketamine-Induced Unconsciousness
publications.authors: S. Sinha, A. Ao, P. Kudallur, V. Lee, A. Mittal

research.title: Intern, Alternative Learning Technologies and Games Lab
research.description: Developed webapp to treat symptomatic PTSD through trauma-informed game design approaches.

research.title: Feedback Control with Application to Robotics @ UC Santa Cruz
research.description: Studied introductory control theory under Prof. Abhishek Halder and Prof. Ricardo Sanfelice.
research.institution: California State Summer School for Mathematics & Science

publications.title: Novel Tools Used in Human-Swarm Interaction
publications.authors: S. Sinha, A. Feng, J. So

projects.title: Drivetrain & Autonomous Director, FRC Team 1868 - Space Cookies
projects.description: Led development of autonomous sequences for 50+ member robotics team; 2x World Championship qualifiers.

projects.title: Co-Founder, Hackakhan
projects.description: Started Khan Lab's School annual edTech hackathon; Grew to 100+ participants in 3 years

projects.title: Mental Health Literacy Project, Senior Capstone, Khan Lab School
projects.description: A platform to promote honest discussions about mental health; Accompanied by an analysis of GenAI tools for app development.

projects.title: Neuroanatomy Educational Website
projects.description: Basic educational website to teach students about brain regions; AP CS A end of term project

awards.title: Aspirations in Computing, National Honorable Mention
awards.organization: National Center for Women & Information Technology
awards.description: Top 400/3000+ applicants; Award recipients are selected based on their aptitude and aspirations in technology and computing, as demonstrated by their computing experience, computing-related activities, leadership experience, persistence, and future plans.

awards.title: High School Scholarship
awards.description: SVEC Education Awards recognize young engineering and technology students for their dedication, focus, and commitment to engineering.

awards.title: Best UI/UX Design for BioHelp website
awards.description: Sponsored by Figma; Awarded for best looking UI and clean diagrams
